3e5006d7-5024-4d01-8845-a22cf06fb08f.description: The badge holder has completed a 4-week virtual work experience as a Junior Digital Engineer in partnership with Inland Rail Skills Academy. In this entry-level experience, they gained industry knowledge analysing different data sets, consulting peers about potential designs and implementation, and designing a digital management system. They have demonstrated creativity in their problem solving, communicated strategically, and been proactive in developing their technical and soft skills.
3e5006d7-5024-4d01-8845-a22cf06fb08f.name: Junior Digital Engineer virtual work experience

badge_template_activities.title: The badge holder has gained an understanding of their workplace and relevant industry through self-paced online learning and connected this knowledge to a broader global context, such as the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals. They took an active role in challenges and tasks designed for the virtual work experience and took frequent opportunities to reflect on their progress and seek feedback.

The badge holder has engaged in and successfully completed a variety of professional tasks, such as applying to participate in the virtual work experience by submitting a video cover letter outlining their suitability for the role and explaining why they were interested in this experience.
The badge holder engaged with the virtual work experience facilitator, industry mentor, and other participants through the community feed and video communication platforms.

The badge holder performed their weekly agenda within predetermined deadlines and in a way that demonstrated an overall understanding of the industry background and project brief. This included  tackling real-world professional tasks related to this field, such as 1 -information management; conceptualising, drafting and presenting modern systems such as ATMS. 2 - Exposure to design platforms to create virtual assets, including 3D modelling.

4782bb30-1a42-4b10-949b-b12d2bdbfc92.description: The badge holder has completed a 4-week virtual work experience as a Civil Construction Cadet in partnership with Inland Rail Skills Academy. As part of this experience, they undertook industry training in geoscience and surveying, safety and sustainability in infrastructure, and refined a construction strategy using data analysis skills. They demonstrated an ability to communicate with stakeholders, problem solve, and work independently in the virtual workplace.
4782bb30-1a42-4b10-949b-b12d2bdbfc92.name: Civil Construction Cadet virtual work experience

This included professional tasks related to the field, including: a) complying with time, budget, and environmental constraints b) understanding construction safety processes and reviewing WHS risk assessments that cover the entire asset life cycle c) conducting ongoing revision of project design

96cdd18b-d9e9-4b04-bd29-d8e4fd2bac6f.description: The badge holder has completed a 4-week virtual work experience as a Communication and Sustainability Cadet in partnership with Inland Rail Skills Academy. In this entry-level experience, they gained industry knowledge on environmental, social, and economic sustainable development and designed a unique large-scale sustainability-themed campaign. They acquired skills in project management and strategic communication and demonstrated professionalism and creativity in their work.
96cdd18b-d9e9-4b04-bd29-d8e4fd2bac6f.name: Communication and Sustainability Cadet virtual work experience

badge_template_activities.title: The badge holder has gained an understanding of their workplace and relevant industry through self-paced online learning and connected this knowledge to a broader global context, such as the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals. They took an active role in challenges and tasks designed for the virtual work experience and took frequent opportunities to reflect on their progress and seek feedback.

The badge holder has engaged in and successfully completed a variety of professional tasks, such as; 1 - Applying to participate in the virtual work experience by submitting a video cover letter outlining their suitability for the role and explaining why they were interested in this experience;  2 - Engaging with the virtual work experience facilitator, industry mentor, and other participants through the community feed and video communication platforms;

3 - Performing the items on their weekly agenda within predetermined deadlines and in a way that demonstrated an overall understanding of the industry background and project brief. The badge holder has shown an ability to tackle real-world professional tasks related to designing their sustainability-themed campaign for Inland Rail, such as ;1 - Conceptualising a sustainability-themed campaign and aligning it with existing corporate strategy at Inland Rail;

2 - Planning campaign's activities and events and researching potential partnerships for an effective campaign implementation; 3 - Designing a campaign communications package; 4 - Scripting and presenting a compelling marketing pitch for the campaign. The outcomes of their work were submitted for the industry expert's review in a form of a project proposal and a client pitch.

6f78ead5-c130-4c14-9337-913c3c6ea221.description: The badge holder has successfully completed a 4-week virtual work experience as a Drone Pilot at Cardno, a global infrastructure, environmental, and social development organisation. They undertook entry-level industry experience in geoscience, GIS, and Drone Surveying and contributed to a geotechnical risk assessment project, from planning to data post-processing. They showed consistency, problem-solving, and independence in the virtual workplace and received feedback on their work.
6f78ead5-c130-4c14-9337-913c3c6ea221.name: Drone Pilot virtual work experience

badge_template_activities.title: The badge holder has gained an understanding of their workplace and relevant industry through self-paced online learning and connected this knowledge to a broader global context, such as the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals. They took an active role in challenges and tasks designed for the virtual work experience and took frequent opportunities to reflect on their progress and seek feedback.

The badge holder has engaged in and successfully completed a variety of professional tasks, such as 1 - Applying to participate in the virtual work experience by submitting a short cover letter outlining their suitability for the role and explaining why they were interested in this experience;  2 - Engaging with the virtual work experience facilitator, industry mentor, and other participants through the community feed and video communication platforms;

3 - Performing the items on their weekly agenda within predetermined deadlines and in a way that demonstrated an overall understanding of the industry background and project brief. The badge holder has shown an ability to tackle real-world professional tasks related to this field, such as 1 - Designing an image acquisition plan and deciding on the ground sampling distance for the drone surveying project, accounting for the terrain type and safety regulations for flying drones in Australia;

2 - Compiling a pre-flight checklist and ascertaining appropriateness of flight conditions based on aerodrome and weather forecasts; 3 - Completing a drone flying simulation; 4 - Stitching drone imagery using photogrammetry software. The outcomes of their work were submitted for the industry expert's review in a form of a portfolio."

6c992587-af3e-4656-833a-ee55faf73602.description: The earner has demonstrated their skills in the workplace through successfully completing virtual work experience, powered by Cardno, a global infrastructure, environmental and social development organisation. The individual applied industry knowledge in a real-world environment and actively utilised their transferable skills. They received feedback to develop these skills and showed consistency in approaches to professionalism in the workplace.
6c992587-af3e-4656-833a-ee55faf73602.name: Environmental Scientist virtual work experience

badge_template_activities.title: The earner gathered knowledge about the workplace and industry through online learning. They took an active role in challenges and task designed during the virtual work placement.

Earners gained practical insight and have shown their ability to tackle real-world challenges related to environmental science; 1: Identify environmental constraints in the project site from aerial imagery with an explanation. 2: Identify potential environmental impacts on construction and operation. 3: Draft a plan to minimise environmental impacts on the identified constraints. Include a site plan, drawings and environmental mitigation measures on the map with a list of considerations.
Earners were also engaged in activities and challenges to identify and suggest solutions to problems related to the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals.

On placement, the earner completed a placement diary or portfolio of personal reflection and progress concerning individual targets and submitted a work experience evaluation. A focus was placed on personal career development goals, help plan next steps and re-evaluate transferable skills via skills assessment.

633b8fad-cc8e-495d-ab0d-1600f9bc4c2c.description: The badge holder has completed a 4-week virtual work experience as a Junior Environmental Planner in partnership with Inland Rail Skills Academy. In this entry-level experience, they gained industry knowledge on environmental, social, and economic sustainable development and conducted an environmental risk assessment for a large-scale infrastructure project. They acquired skills in project management and problem solving, and demonstrated professionalism and creativity in their work.
633b8fad-cc8e-495d-ab0d-1600f9bc4c2c.name: Junior Environmental Planner virtual work experience

42416275-8e52-4160-a164-4e22776c3e80.description: The badge holder has completed a 4-week virtual work experience as an Electrical Technician with Inland Rail, Australia's largest railway project. In this entry-level experience, they gained industry knowledge of electrical safety and maintenance with a focus on track circuit repair. They have demonstrated creativity in their problem solving, communicated strategically, and been proactive in developing their technical and soft skills.
42416275-8e52-4160-a164-4e22776c3e80.name: Electrical Technician

2b5ca413-5f03-4fef-bc09-728bcb368b15.description: The badge holder has completed a 4-week virtual work experience as a Systems and Signals Operator in partnership with Inland Rail Skills Academy. As part of this experience, they undertook industry training in signalling systems, safety procedures, and emergency response coordination. They demonstrated an ability to communicate across teams, multitask, problem solve, and work independently in the virtual workplace.
2b5ca413-5f03-4fef-bc09-728bcb368b15.name: Systems and Signals Operator virtual work experience
